Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: Sure you are a seller and it is great to make money. Here is my experience. I had a fraudulent charge on my account. On day 1, I contacted the seller and informed them of the fraud. On day1, I contacted Paypal and informed their security group of the fraud. On day1, I called my bank and put a stop payment. Therefore a shipment should never have been made. Since I have a stop payment on my bank account, I know that Paypal has not paid the seller because it only pays after verifying shipment and delivery and only after collecting my funds straight out of my account. Here is the problem. My paypal account shows a negative balance after the positive balance I carried on Paypal was taken out. My account is limited. I cannot remove my bank account from Paypal. I cannot remove the addresses on my Paypal that the fraudster added. Reaching Paypal is not easy. You get to the first agent who transfers you to the folks who can help unfreeze/unlimit your account and you wait for about 20 minutes and you get cut-off. Happened to me 5 times. The agents will not call back because I was told by multiple agents that they do not. Ebay is successful because it allows you to have a garage sale without having traffic at your doorstep or your neighbors knowing that you are having a garage sell. It allows you to sell without having a store front. And Paypal benefits because of a near monopoly with ebay. But is is the most customer unfriendly service when you have a problem. Don't get me wrong the customer service personnel are very friendly, they apologize for the slightest of things, very polite but will tell you sorry we do not call back and when the phone is cut-off when the problem gets tough, you have to start again. Very convenient in normal times. but very inconvenient when you have a problem. Customer service is not 24 hours and long wait times for customer service. Had two incidences so far. Try a complicated problem and see how fast you get cut-off.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: I do agree, Paypal has the absolute worst customer service of any financial institution ever. For example : I have BofA for my banking. I can call them at 4AM and get a customer service rep if I ever lost my debit card or my account was breached. Paypal, on the other hand, is nearly impossible to contact. This is why Paypal is always on Consumerist's "Worst companies in America" tournament.

Topic.Title: Paypal and Discover card will start April 19, here comes the $$$$$

Message.Msg: Please tell me why anybody would use Paypal at the checkout counter? Paypal is an online payment intermediary mainly forced on eBay users. Most people have credit cards and debit cards, heck, I even have a Paypal debit card and the Paypal rewards Mastercard. I simply don't see the necessity for Paypal at brick & mortar stores. Not to mention, now they're stepping into Visa and Mastercard's territory.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: "Paypal, on the other hand, is nearly impossible to contact" You need to pick up the phone and call them. Their phone number is on the site, they give you a pin number, and answer the phone when you call. It's as simple as that.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: These days, I never accept payments more than $500 through Paypal and NEVER leave any balance. It's off to the ATM every day to clean out my Paypal account. Since you're such an experienced seller, I'm sure you've read similar threads on the Powersseller's forum about cleaning out your Paypal account daily.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: I'm sure you also know to NEVER link your Paypal account to a bank account that matters. It's much easier to open an account specifically for Paypal with limited funds in it.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: I used to say the same thing too until they got me. Funny, eBay discussion boards are full of trolls like that guy Danny (aka honeville) who #$%$ on other sellers experiencing problems with eBay/Paypal just because "it hadn't happened to him" - Guess what, he got nailed last year and crying like a baby but nobody cared because he towed the eBay line for so long. Most intelligent people know that some horror stories are fabricated, others are thalf-truths BUT, not everybody is bending the truth when it comes to negative dealings. Smart people learn to protect themselves and some actually warn others. Towing the line for some corporation who could care less if you live or die is pathetic.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: I totally agree. My bank issued me an automatic notice of transfer of funds from my account in the late evening. I had to wait to call Paypal until the next morning but was able to call my bank right away and place a hold on the transfer. And by doing this, I actually saved Paypal $3000 dollars right away and discouraged a fraud who just experienced the system telling him he will get caught.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: So you get a person on the line, who then transfers you to another department. There is music playing (you would think in this age of automation, you could select the music while you wait) and after 15 minutes the calls cut off. It happened to me five times until I was able to resolve the issue after I had to yell at the customer service person to tell her to stop apologizing and feeling sorry for me and to just fix the problem.

Topic.Title: Have you had a problem with ebay and paypal fraud?

Message.Msg: I am not a seller and in this case was not a buyer. Paypal pulled the money out of my bank. And here is the best part. I talked to Paypal. Paypal limited my account. Then I called my bank to place a hold on the transfer. So now because my bank rejected the transfer, Paypal went to my credit card. I have an obsolete credit card listed there because I am forced to provide a money source. Why would they go to my credit card after I have reported that this is a purchase that I did not make and the address of delivery is not mine. I have never been to Missourie (I am not sure I spelled it right).
